content.content: 1727×624 41.7 KB  Hi everyone, thanks for checking out the State of Dai. Now separate from the Weekly Relay with the objective to scale and improve all the information you need for your Dai escapades!  The public PDF version is available here.    Peg864×616 94.7 KB   Some market wobbles in the past 24 hours, but the peg is mostly solid.   DAI Supply1350×736 81.7 KB   The slightest reduction in DAI supply, including less USDC exposure.  Visit Makerburn for an up-to-the-minute breakdown.  Vault changes1211×897 156 KB   ETH-C and WBTC-C continue to rally in deposits, almost completely offsetting ETH-A and WBTC-A reductions.    ETH-C vault protection looks like a peace symbol; may the markets follow that sentiment. Capital at risk is only 2.3 million.    Debt outstanding looking exponential on WBTC-C vaults over the past five months.    Total debt is almost 100 million, and the average debt at 47 K  Since DAI outstanding has been somewhat flat, it is worth zooming out to look at the ecosystem more. Compound recently reduced its COMP rewards last month. Their community had a nail-biting vote to remove them completely this last week. Here is a convenient thread from one of their Delegates that covers the meta of voting power and the recent proposal (No. 100):  twitter.com    0x7751 @0x7751  This was such an interesting vote because it was super meta. At its core, it was a vote about how the protocol should distribute voting power. Most of the No votes would probably also argue that it was about managing user acquisition costs and incentives.   9:07 PM - 23 Apr 2022           1             Compound Dash says less leverage1250×903 126 KB   The compound monitor dashboard indicates recursive positions have stayed through the tumultuous vote. Jan from Risk recently posted on Compound’s forum with amazing research as always.   Recursive farm is sticky1129×581 196 KB   Putting the borrow markets in perspective, the change over the past few weeks has been minor (-10%). Sticky farm is sticky.  daistats.com | makerburn.com | maker.blockanalitica.com  We Are Daing for Your Feedback We value your input! Take our survey to let us know what we might be missing or how to do better. Disclaimer: This update is assembled by a group of contributing members in the MakerDAO community. This does not serve as financial advice or an inducement to vote in any specific way. This update is for information and communication purposes only.  Credit @twblack88
I am surprised at how particularly stable DAI looks despite the clear bear market we are in.
Bullish on DAI. Bullish on Maker. Let’s go!
Always Bullish with Maker and DAI
Excellent resume my fren! In data we trust, loving Maker & DAI

1727×624 40 KB  Hi everyone, thanks for checking out the State of Dai. Now separate from the Weekly Relay with the objective to scale and improve all the information you need for your Dai escapades!  The public PDF version is available here.   Peg910×658 149 KB   ETH market this week has been wobbly. Especially in the past 24 hours. DAI was mostly trading at a premium if out of peg.   761×398 64.5 KB   Max/Min from Uniswap v2, which is no surprise though certainly less exciting than last week.   DAI Supply1361×748 80.5 KB   DAI supply continues to a slight reduction. However, generated collateral continues to diversify away from PSM-USDC. Average collateralization is 159% at the time of writing.   Vault changes1428×849 143 KB   ETH-A outflows and staked ETH inflows over the last week. ETH-C continues to climb up the total vault count chart.   Maker in the whole market1734×795 130 KB   Holistically, we control less of the WBTC market this week but a still dominant on ETH.   Organic Demand is up1414×650 182 KB   Net Organic Demand is up over the week across multiple vault types.   Borrow/repay855×603 50.6 KB   Another week of net burns and refinancing (-) 66 million.  Visit Makerburn for an up-to-the-minute breakdown.  Where is DAI?1270×570 66.9 KB  Curious where DAI goes? @makerburn released a page full of fun rabbit holes to explore.  Liquidation breakdown per drop907×489 62.7 KB   With recent drops across the market, liquidations start to get hairy at ~18% price drops.    You can see when low-risk vaults get affected per bucket on the drop.   One big vault with14K ETH collateral at risk957×600 131 KB   In a max pain scenario, one of the biggest ETH-A vaults would be hypothetically at risk.   Big vault history means they are on top1129×450 40.4 KB   But, a look at the history suggests active management. WAGMI.  daistats.com | makerburn.com | maker.blockanalitica.com   Have Feedback? dai-dissolve-4-18-edit1727×624 40.5 KB  Hi everyone, thanks for checking out the State of Dai. Now separate from the Weekly Relay with the objective to scale and improve all the information you need for your Dai escapades!     The public PDF version is available here.   Peg873×617 90.9 KB   Peg sailing smoother than an emirates first-class flight to Amsterdam.    Digging in, the PSM trend over the past month has been leveling off.   DAI Supply1359×749 78.4 KB   TVL is almost the same, but DAI generated hovering just above 9 billion. Outstanding DAI from USDC PSM is at 50.9% (slowly reducing).  Visit Makerburn for an up-to-the-minute breakdown and all these fancy new pages they keep launching.  Growth over the week y'all883×463 70 KB   Like this growth page that breaks down supply and PnL.   Vault changes1105×850 147 KB   Speaking of growth, some weekly vault changes of note: WBTC-C saw large mints totaling 19 Mil. Increases in ETH-C and staked ETH, despite a reduction in our flagship Vaults. Though the number of ETH-A vaults decreased, there was more DAI generation.   1137×511 47.8 KB   Bump in the GUNI .01% ilk by 50MM. The push in the DC unlocked a latent demand wizard .    Since staked ETH keeps growing, let’s take a look. Collateralization in staked ETH is strong, as is the risk premium and protection for vaults.    Protected wstETH vaults at 60%     Liquidation breakdown per drop1049×435 65.9 KB   Current Capital at Risk: $40,954,784 at time of writing. That looks like a steep liquidation cliff at 17%.    May the OSM be ever in your favor; this last week saw seven auctions and 8MM in debt collected.  daistats.com | makerburn.com | maker.blockanalitica.com  We Are aing for Your Feedback We value your input!
